LocationRemarks: southeast of Starvation Bay
southeast of Starvation Bay
west of Starvation Bay
HabitatRemarks: logging road, seral stage mixed forest

ObservationNotes: Ca 60 pls in 4 m sq, scattered along bluffs. Conservation Status:CDC: Yellow.
CuratorRemarks: reported as Amsinckia retrorsa but this species is no longer recognized as part of the BC Flora (Marta Donovan pers. comm. 2021); Amsinckia menziesii reported instead, until name can be confirmed by curators at the RBCM; cannot find coordinates via the RBCM database

LocationRemarks: on west cliffs.
HabitatRemarks: On sandstone cliffs, on enclave with Allium acuminatum, Camas liechnitti; aspect south 28 degrees west.
SpecimenNotes: Ca. 60 plants in 4 square meters, scattered along bluffs.
CuratorRemarks: Amsinckia tessellata var. tessellata not recognized in BC; compare with Amsinckia menziesii

LocationRemarks: northwest side, opposite south end of De Courcy Island, north side of little bay.
HabitatRemarks: Seaside sandstone clifftop, full sun; beside single A. columbiana, A. uva-ursi seen down by shoreline.

LocationRemarks: northwest side, opposite south end of De Courcy Island, little bay, 100 m east of seashore.
HabitatRemarks: Moist track through forest opening; disturbed seepy sites with Gnaphalium palustre, Juncus bufonius, J. effusus subsp. pacificus, Hypericum anagalloides, Spiranthes romanzoffiana.

LocationRemarks: northwest side, opposite south end of De Courcy Island, little bay, 100 m east of seashore
HabitatRemarks: Moist track through forest opening; bare soil with Gnaphalium palustre, Juncus bufonius, J. effusus subsp. pacificus, Hypericum anagalloides.

LocationRemarks: northeast end
HabitatRemarks: On shallow soil over bedrock in seepage area; asp. N 54 degrees E, 15 percent slope.
SpecimenNotes: No identifiable features on associated immature Plagiobothrys.
GeoreferencingRemarks: original coordinates place this collection in the Strait of Georgia; coordinates shunted to potential coastal habitat toward northeast end of the island; locational uncertainty is high

LocationRemarks: northwest side, opposite south end of De Courcy Island, north side of little bay.
SpecimenNotes: Single flexible shrub spreading from overhang. Only one seen in the vicinity.

LocationRemarks: northwest side, opposite south end of De Courcy Island, little bay, 100 m east of seashore.
HabitatRemarks: Trackside water pool on grassy bank.
SpecimenNotes: Few plants; becoming a frequent weed in grassy sites on the Gulf Islands.

LocationRemarks: northwest side, opposite south end of De Courcy Island
HabitatRemarks: Seaside sandstone cliffs in cracks near high tide line, with Lonicera hispidula, Paxistima myrsinites.
ObservationNotes: A few occurences along the cliffs.
